df-pths
blocks.content: Define the set of all paths (in an undirected graph). According to Wikipedia ("Path (graph theory)", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Path_(graph_theory) , 3-Oct-2017): "A path is a trail in which all vertices (except possibly the first and last) are distinct. ... use the term simple path to refer to a path which contains no repeated vertices." According to Bollobas: "... a path is a walk with distinct vertices.", see Notation of [Bollobas] p. 5. (A walk with distinct vertices is actually a simple path, see ~ upgrwlkdvspth ). Therefore, a path can be represented by an injective mapping f from { 1 , ... , n } and a mapping p from { 0 , ... , n }, which is injective restricted to the set { 1 , ... , n }, where f enumerates the (indices of the) different edges, and p enumerates the vertices. So the path is also represented by the following sequence: p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens and Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: df-spths
blocks.content: Define the set of all simple paths (in an undirected graph). According to Wikipedia ("Path (graph theory)", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Path_(graph_theory) , 3-Oct-2017): "A path is a trail in which all vertices (except possibly the first and last) are distinct. ... use the term simple path to refer to a path which contains no repeated vertices." Therefore, a simple path can be represented by an injective mapping f from { 1 , ... , n } and an injective mapping p from { 0 , ... , n }, where f enumerates the (indices of the) different edges, and p enumerates the vertices. So the simple path is also represented by the following sequence: p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: df-pthson
blocks.content: Define the collection of paths with particular endpoints (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens and Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2021.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-pthson(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cpthson, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), copab(s3, s4, wa(wbr(cv(s3), co(cv(s1), cfv(ctrlson, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), cv(s4)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cpths, cv(s0)), cv(s4)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-pthson(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ PathsOn =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(Vtx ` s0), s2 ‚àà(Vtx ` s0)‚Ü¶ { < s3, s4 > |(s3[(s1[(TrailsOn ` s0)]s2)]s4 ‚àß s3[(Paths ` s0)]s4)}))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
}

blocks.name: df-spthson
blocks.content: Define the collection of simple paths with particular endpoints (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2021.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-spthson(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cspthson, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), copab(s3, s4, wa(wbr(cv(s3), co(cv(s1), cfv(ctrlson, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), cv(s4)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cspths, cv(s0)), cv(s4)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-spthson(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ SPathsOn =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(Vtx ` s0), s2 ‚àà(Vtx ` s0)‚Ü¶ { < s3, s4 > |(s3[(s1[(TrailsOn ` s0)]s2)]s4 ‚àß s3[(SPaths ` s0)]s4)}))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
}

blocks.name: relpths
blocks.content: The set ` ( Paths `` G ) ` of all paths on ` G ` is a set of pairs by our definition of a path, and so is a relation. (Contributed by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: pthsfval
blocks.content: The set of paths (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2021.) (Revised by AV, 29-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm pthsfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wceq(cfv(cpths, c0), copab(s0, s1, w3a(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  eqtri(cfv(cpths, c0), copab(s0, s1, w3a(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls))), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls)))))
  mptru(wceq(cfv(cpths, c0), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls))))))
  fvmptopab(s0, s1, hs0, cpths, c0, ctrls, wtru, wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls)))
  biidd(wa(wtru, wceq(cv(hs0), c0)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls)))
  a1i(wtru, wcel(copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1))), universe))
  ssexi(copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1))), copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1))))
  wksv(s0, s1, c0)
  ssopab2i(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)))
  trliswlk(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))
  eqtri(cpths, cmpt(hs0, universe, copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, cv(hs0)), cv(s1)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls))))), cmpt(hs0, universe, copab(s0, s1, w3a(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, cv(hs0)), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls)))))
  df-pths(hs0, s0, s1)
  mpteq2i(hs0, universe, copab(s0, s1, w3a(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, cv(hs0)), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls))), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, cv(hs0)), cv(s1)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls)))))
  opabbii(s0, s1, w3a(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, cv(hs0)), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls)), wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, cv(hs0)), cv(s1)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls))))
  3anass(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, cv(hs0)), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls))
  opabbii(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls))), w3a(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls)))
  bicomi(wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls))), w3a(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls)))
  3anass(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.wtru.s(s0)
  diff.wtru.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wtru)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(s1), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(s0)))), cima(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))))), emptycls)))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: spthsfval
blocks.content: The set of simple paths (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 21-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2021.) (Revised by AV, 29-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm spthsfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wceq(cfv(cspths, c0), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  mptru(wceq(cfv(cspths, c0), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1)))))))
  fvmptopab(s0, s1, hs0, cspths, c0, ctrls, wtru, wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))))
  biidd(wa(wtru, wceq(cv(hs0), c0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))))
  a1i(wtru, wcel(copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1))), universe))
  ssexi(copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1))), copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1))))
  wksv(s0, s1, c0)
  ssopab2i(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)))
  trliswlk(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))
  df-spths(hs0, s0, s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.wtru.s(s0)
  diff.wtru.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wtru)
  diff.hs0.w(wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm spthsfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (SPaths ` c0)= { < s0, s1 > |(s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 ‚àß Fun(`' s1))}
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  mptru((SPaths ` c0)= { < s0, s1 > |(s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 ‚àß Fun(`' s1))})
  fvmptopab(s0, s1, hs0, cspths, c0, ctrls, wtru, Fun(`' s1), Fun(`' s1))
  biidd((T ‚àß hs0 = c0), Fun(`' s1))
  a1i(wtru, { < s0, s1 > | s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 } ‚àà ùïå)
  ssexi({ < s0, s1 > | s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 }, { < s0, s1 > | s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1 })
  wksv(s0, s1, c0)
  ssopab2i(s0, s1, s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1, s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1)
  trliswlk(s0, c0, s1)
  df-spths(hs0, s0, s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.wtru.s(s0)
  diff.wtru.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wtru)
  diff.hs0.w(Fun(`' s1))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: ispth
blocks.content: Conditions for a pair of classes/functions to be a path (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 21-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2021.) (Revised by AV, 29-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm ispth(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), w3a(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(cres(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))), wceq(cin(cima(c2, cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, c0))), cima(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))), emptycls)))
} = {
  bitr4i(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), w3a(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(cres(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))), wceq(cin(cima(c2, cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, c0))), cima(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))), emptycls)), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))), wceq(cin(cima(c2, cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, c0))), cima(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))), emptycls))))
  brfvopabrbr(hs1, hs0, c0, cpths, c1, c2, ctrls, wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))), wceq(cin(cima(c2, cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, c0))), cima(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))), emptycls)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(hs0), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(hs0), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))), cima(cv(hs0), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs1))))), emptycls)))
  eqtri(cfv(cpths, c1), copab(hs1, hs0, wa(wbr(cv(hs1), cfv(ctrls, c1), cv(hs0)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(hs0), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(hs0), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))), cima(cv(hs0), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs1))))), emptycls)))), copab(hs1, hs0, w3a(wbr(cv(hs1), cfv(ctrls, c1), cv(hs0)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(hs0), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(hs0), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))), cima(cv(hs0), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs1))))), emptycls))))
  pthsfval(hs1, hs0, c1)
  opabbii(hs1, hs0, w3a(wbr(cv(hs1), cfv(ctrls, c1), cv(hs0)), wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(hs0), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(hs0), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))), cima(cv(hs0), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs1))))), emptycls)), wa(wbr(cv(hs1), cfv(ctrls, c1), cv(hs0)), wa(wfun(ccnv(cres(cv(hs0), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))))), wceq(cin(cima(cv(hs0), cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, cv(hs1)))), cima(cv(hs0), co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs1))))), emptycls))))

blocks.name: isspth
blocks.content: Conditions for a pair of classes/functions to be a simple path (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 21-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2021.) (Revised by AV, 29-Oct-2021.)

thm isspth(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))))
} = {
  brfvopabrbr(hs1, hs0, c0, cspths, c1, c2, ctrls, wfun(ccnv(c2)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs0))))
  spthsfval(hs1, hs0, c1)
  adantl(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wb(wfun(ccnv(cv(hs0))), wfun(ccnv(c2))))
  funeqd(ccnv(cv(hs0)), ccnv(c2), wceq(cv(hs0), c2))
  cnveq(cv(hs0), c2)
  reltrls(c1)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(ctrls)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(ctrls)
  diff.hs1.w(wfun(ccnv(c2)))
  diff.hs0.w(wfun(ccnv(c2)))
}

  ‚ä¢ (c0[(SPaths ` c1)]c2 ‚Üî(c0[(Trails ` c1)]c2 ‚àß Fun(`' c2)))
} = {
  brfvopabrbr(hs1, hs0, c0, cspths, c1, c2, ctrls, Fun(`' c2), Fun(`' hs0))
  spthsfval(hs1, hs0, c1)
  adantl(hs1 = c0, hs0 = c2, (Fun(`' hs0)‚Üî Fun(`' c2)))
  funeqd(`' hs0, `' c2, hs0 = c2)
  cnveq(hs0, c2)
  reltrls(c1)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)

blocks.name: upgr2pthnlp
blocks.content: A path of length at least 2 in a pseudograph does not contain a loop. (Contributed by AV, 6-Feb-2021.)

  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ciedg, c0))

  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  mpd(w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cpths, c0), c2), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c1))), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), nat2)), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))))))

  imp(w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cpths, c0), c2), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(chash, c1))), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1))), wi(wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))))), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), nat2)))

  impcom(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cpths, c0), c2), wi(wcel(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1))), wi(wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))))), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), nat2))))

  pthiswlk(c1, c0, c2)
  wlkf(c1, c0, c2, c3)
  3exp(wcel(c1, cword(cdm(c3))), wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1))), wi(wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))))), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), nat2)))
  mpand(w3a(wcel(c1, cword(cdm(c3))), wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)))), wbr(nat2, cle, cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))))), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), nat2), wbr(cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), cle, nat2))

  pm3.2i(wcel(cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), cxr), wcel(nat2, cxr))
  mp2b(wcel(cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), cxr), wcel(cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), universe), wcel(cfv(chash, cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), cxnn0))
  fvex(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)))

blocks.name: spthdifv
blocks.content: The vertices of a simple path are distinct, so the vertex function is one-to-one. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-Jan-2018.) (Revised by AV, 5-Jun-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: spthdep
blocks.content: A simple path (at least of length 1) has different start and end points (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by AV, 31-Jan-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)

thm spthdep(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2), wne(cfv(chash, c0), nat0)), wne(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))))
} = {
  imp(wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2), wne(cfv(chash, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))))

  jca(wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))), wf1(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1)), wa(wcel(cfv(chash, c0), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(nat0, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)))))
  sylibr(wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))), wf1(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1)), wa(wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1)), wfun(ccnv(c2))))
  anim1i(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2)), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1)))
  syl(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1)), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2))

  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c1))
  df-f1(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1))
  adantr(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2)), wa(wcel(cfv(chash, c0), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(nat0, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)))))
  3syl(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wa(wcel(cfv(chash, c0), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(nat0, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)))), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0))
  trliswlk(c0, c1, c2)
  wlkcl(c0, c1, c2)
  jca(wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(nat0, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))))
  biimpi(wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))))
  nn0fz0(cfv(chash, c0))
  0elfz(cfv(chash, c0))
  syl5bi(wa(wf1(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1)), wa(wcel(cfv(chash, c0), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(nat0, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))))), wceq(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), nat0), wceq(cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(c2, nat0)))

blocks.name: pthdepisspth

blocks.origin:
thm pthdepisspth(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wne(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))), wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2))
} = {
  sylibr(wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wne(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))), wbr(c0, cfv(cspths, c1), c2), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))))
  imp(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wne(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))))
  sylbi(wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wi(wne(cfv(c2, nat0), cfv(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2)))), w3a(wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(cres(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))), wceq(cin(cima(c2, cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, c0))), cima(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))), emptycls)))
  ispth(c0, c1, c2)

blocks.name: upgrwlkdvde
blocks.content: In a pseudograph, all edges of a walk consisting of different vertices are different. Notice that this theorem would not hold for arbitrary hypergraphs, see the counterexample given in the comment of ~ upgrspthswlk . (Contributed by AV, 17-Jan-2021.)

  simplbi2((c2 :(0[...](# ` c1))‚Üí(Vtx ` c0)), Fun(`' c2), (c2 :(0[...](# ` c1))‚Ü£(Vtx ` c0)))
  df-f1(c2, (0[...](# ` c1)), (Vtx ` c0))

  simpr3(Fun(`' c2), c1 ‚àà Word(dom((iEdg ` c0))), (c2 :(0[...](# ` c1))‚Üí(Vtx ` c0)), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c1)),((iEdg ` c0)`(c1 ` hs0))= {(c2 ` hs0),(c2 `(hs0[+]1))}))

blocks.name: upgrspthswlk
blocks.content: The set of simple paths in a pseudograph, expressed as walk. Notice that this theorem would not hold for arbitrary hypergraphs, since a walk with distinct vertices does not need to be a trail: let E = { p_0, p_1, p_2 } be a hyperedge, then ( p_0, e, p_1, e, p_2 ) is walk with distinct vertices, but not with distinct edges. Therefore, E is not a trail and, by definition, also no path. (Contributed by AV, 11-Jan-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 17-Jan-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm upgrspthswlk(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wceq(cfv(cspths, c0), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl5eq(cfv(cspths, c0), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))))), copab(s0, s1, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))))), wcel(c0, cupgr))
  spthsfval(s0, s1, c0)
  opabbidv(s0, s1, wcel(c0, cupgr), wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1)))), wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1)))))
  pm5.32rd(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)))
  ex(wcel(c0, cupgr), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))), wb(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1))))
  syl6rbbr(wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1)))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(ctrls, c0), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0)))))
  pm4.71d(wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1)))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0))))
  imp(wcel(c0, cupgr), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0)))))
  com23(wcel(c0, cupgr), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0))))
  3exp(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s1))), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0))))
  upgrwlkdvde(c0, cv(s0), cv(s1))
  istrl(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cupgr)
  diff.cupgr.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, cupgr)
  diff.cupgr.s(s1)
}

thm upgrspthswlk(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚Üí(SPaths ` c0)= { < s0, s1 > |(s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1 ‚àß Fun(`' s1))})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)

  spthsfval(s0, s1, c0)
  opabbidv(s0, s1, c0 ‚àà UPGraph, (s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 ‚àß Fun(`' s1)), (s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1 ‚àß Fun(`' s1)))
  pm5.32rd(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1, Fun(`' s1), s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1)
  ex(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, Fun(`' s1), (s0[(Trails ` c0)]s1 ‚Üî s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1))

  pm4.71d((c0 ‚àà UPGraph ‚àß Fun(`' s1)), s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1, Fun(`' s0))
  imp(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, Fun(`' s1), (s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1 ‚Üí Fun(`' s0)))
  com23(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, Fun(`' s1), s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1, Fun(`' s0))
  3exp(c0 ‚àà UPGraph, s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1, Fun(`' s1), Fun(`' s0))

blocks.name: upgrwlkdvspth
blocks.content: A walk consisting of different vertices is a simple path. Notice that this theorem would not hold for arbitrary hypergraphs, see the counterexample given in the comment of ~ upgrspthswlk . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 27-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 17-Jan-2021.)

thm upgrwlkdvspth(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))), wbr(c1, cfv(cspths, c0), c2))
} = {
  mpbird(w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))), wbr(c1, cfv(cspths, c0), c2), wa(wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))))
  3simpc(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2)))
  bitrd(w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))), wbr(c1, cfv(cspths, c0), c2), wa(wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))), wbr(c1, copab(hs0, hs1, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(hs1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs1))))), c2))
  breqd(c1, cfv(cspths, c0), c2, copab(hs0, hs1, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(hs1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs1))))), w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2)), wceq(cfv(cspths, c0), copab(hs0, hs1, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(hs1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs1)))))))
  upgrspthswlk(hs0, hs1, c0)
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))), wb(wbr(c1, copab(hs0, hs1, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(hs1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs1))))), c2), wa(wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2)))), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2)), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))
  syl(wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, universe)), w3a(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))
  wlkv(c1, c0, c2)
  3simpc(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, universe))
  brabga(hs0, hs1, c1, universe, c2, universe, copab(hs0, hs1, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(hs1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs1))))), wa(wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2))), wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(hs1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs1)))))
  anbi12d(wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(hs1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs1))), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wfun(ccnv(c2)))
  breq12(cv(hs0), c1, cv(hs1), c2, cfv(cwlks, c0))
  adantl(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wb(wfun(ccnv(cv(hs1))), wfun(ccnv(c2))))
  funeqd(ccnv(cv(hs1)), ccnv(c2), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))

blocks.name: spthonisspth

blocks.content: In a simple graph, any walk of length 2 between two different vertices is a simple path. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 2-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 27-Jan-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 31-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: usgr2pth
blocks.content: In a simple graph, there is a path of length 2 iff there are three distinct vertices so that one of them is connected to each of the two others by an edge. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 27-Jan-2018.) (Revised by AV, 5-Jun-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 31-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: usgr2pth0
blocks.content: In a simply graph, there is a path of length 2 iff there are three distinct vertices so that one of them is connected to each of the two others by an edge. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 27-Jan-2018.) (Revised by AV, 5-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: pthd

thm pthd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2))

  -| wceq(cfv(chash, c0), c3)
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2)), diffsc(s0, c3))
  syl3anbrc(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(cpths, c1), c2), wbr(c0, cfv(ctrls, c1), c2), wfun(ccnv(cres(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))), wceq(cin(cima(c2, cpr(nat0, cfv(chash, c0))), cima(c2, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))), emptycls))
  pthdlem1(s0, s1, c2, cfv(chash, c0), w0)
  pthdlem2(s0, s1, c2, cfv(chash, c0), w0)
  eqtri(cfv(chash, c0), co(cfv(chash, c2), cmin, nat1), c3)
  sylibr(w0, wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wral(s1, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wi(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wne(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(s1)))))), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wral(s1, co(nat1, cfzo, c3), wi(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wne(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(s1)))))))
  ralbii(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wral(s1, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wi(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wne(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(s1))))), wral(s1, co(nat1, cfzo, c3), wi(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wne(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(s1))))))
  raleqi(s1, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), co(nat1, cfzo, c3), wi(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wne(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(s1)))))
  oveq2i(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0), c3)

thm pthd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0[(Paths ` c1)]c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà Word(ùïå))
  ‚ä£ c3 =((# ` c2)[-]1)

  ‚ä£ (# ` c0)= c3
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0[(Trails ` c1)]c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)

} = {
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí c0[(Paths ` c1)]c2), d(s0, c3))
  syl3anbrc(w0, c0[(Paths ` c1)]c2, c0[(Trails ` c1)]c2, Fun(`'(c2 |`(1[..^](# ` c0)))), ((c2 " { 0,(# ` c0)})‚ãÇ(c2 "(1[..^](# ` c0))))= ‚àÖ)
  pthdlem1(s0, s1, c2, (# ` c0), w0)
  pthdlem2(s0, s1, c2, (# ` c0), w0)
  eqtri((# ` c0), ((# ` c2)[-]1), c3)
  sylibr(w0, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c2)), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(1[..^](# ` c0)),(s0 ‚â† s1 ‚Üí(c2 ` s0)‚â†(c2 ` s1)))), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c2)), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(1[..^]c3),(s0 ‚â† s1 ‚Üí(c2 ` s0)‚â†(c2 ` s1)))))
  ralbii(s0, (0[..^](# ` c2)), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(1[..^](# ` c0)),(s0 ‚â† s1 ‚Üí(c2 ` s0)‚â†(c2 ` s1))), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(1[..^]c3),(s0 ‚â† s1 ‚Üí(c2 ` s0)‚â†(c2 ` s1))))
  raleqi(s1, (1[..^](# ` c0)), (1[..^]c3), (s0 ‚â† s1 ‚Üí(c2 ` s0)‚â†(c2 ` s1)))
  oveq2i(nat1, cfzo, (# ` c0), c3)

  diff.co.s(s1, nat1, cfzo, c3)

  diff.cfzo.s(s1)
}
